00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 parserCustomization.pl - Placeholder for site/course-local customization file.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Copy this file to your course templates directory and put any
00024 customization for the Parser that you want for your course
00025 here.  For example, you can make vectors display using
00026 ijk notation (and force students to use it for entering
00027 vectors) by uncommenting:
00028 
00029     $context{Vector} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Vector");
00030     $context{Vector}->flags->set(ijk=>1);
00031     $context{Vector}->parens->remove('<');
00032 
00033 To allow vectors to be entered with parens (and displayed with
00034 parens) rather than angle-brakets, uncomment
00035 
00036     $context{Vector} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Vector");
00037     $context{Vector}->{cmpDefaults}{Vector} = {promotePoints => 1};
00038     $context{Vector}->lists->set(Vector=>{open=>'(', close=>')'});
00039 
00040 (This actually just turns points into vectors in the answer checker
00041 for vectors, and displays vectors using parens rather than angle
00042 brakets.  The student is really still entering what the Parser
00043 thinks is a point, but since points get promoted automatically
00044 in the Value package, that should work.  But if a problem checks
00045 if a student's value is actually a Vector, that will not be true.)
00046 
00047 =cut
00048 
00049 sub _parserCustomization_init {}
00050 
00051 1;
